The waffle chart below gives a birds-eye view of a year's worth of AQI days for Minneapolis, MN.

## Load packages
```{r, message=F}
#devtools::install_github("hrbrmstr/waffle")
library(waffle)
```

## Create example AQI data
```{r}

minne_aqi <- c(`Good` = 180, 
               `Moderate`  = 110, 
               `Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups` = 59, 
               `Unhealthy` = 16)

aqi_colors <- c("#65B345", "#F2BE1A", "#F26522", "#B11117")
```

## Create the waffle plot
```{r}
waffle(minne_aqi, 
       rows=7, 
       size=0.6, 
       colors=aqi_colors,
       xlab="1 square = 1 day",
       title="AQI days for Minneapolis, MN\n2020")
``` 

![wide waffle](images/waffles_wide.png)


## Use `flip=TRUE` to make a vertical waffle
```{r}
waffle(minne_aqi, 
       rows=7, 
       size=0.5, 
       colors=aqi_colors,
       xlab="1 square = 1 day",
       title="AQI days for Minneapolis, MN\n2020",
       flip=T)
```

![tall waffle](images/waffles_tall.png)

## To melt multiple waffles together use the `iron` function

```{r, tidy=T}
# For year 2020
aqi_2020 <- waffle(minne_aqi, 
       rows=7, 
       size=0.6, 
       colors=aqi_colors,
       xlab="\n",
       title="AQI days for Minneapolis, MN\n\n2020")

# For year 2025
## Create data
minne_aqi_2025 <- c(`Good` = 240, 
                    `Moderate`  = 92, 
                    `Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups` = 29, 
                    `Unhealthy` = 4)

aqi_2025 <- waffle(minne_aqi_2025, 
       rows=7, 
       size=0.6, 
       colors=aqi_colors,
       xlab="1 square = 1 day",
       title="2025")

# Stack 2020 and 2025  waffles
iron(aqi_2020, aqi_2025)
````` 

![stacked waffle](images/waffles_stack.png)
